channel.title: National Association of Educational Broadcasters convention highlights 1968
channel.description:
Highlights of the November 1968 convention of the National Association of Educational Broadcasters in Washington, D.C.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

image.title: National Association of Educational Broadcasters convention highlights 1968

item.title: Wilbur Cohen, reel 2
item.description: Wilbur Cohen, secretary of the Department of Health, Education and Welfare and one of the architects of the New Deal and Great Society programs, invokes the convention's theme, "Freedom from Ignorance," and comments on public broadcasting's role in other national goals, including "freedom of speech, freedom of worship, freedom from want, and freedom from fear." Introduced by William Harley, president, National Association of Educational Broadcasters.
item.dc:creator: American University (Washington, D.C.)
item.dc:subject: U.S. Politics

item.title: Nicholas Johnson, reel 1
item.description: Nicholas Johnson, Federal Communications Commission, on "The Financing of Educational Broadcasting." Introduced by John P. Witherspoon, general manager, KEBS-TV and FM, San Diego State College.
item.dc:creator: American University (Washington, D.C.)
item.dc:subject: U.S. Politics

item.title: Nicholas Johnson, reel 2
item.description: Nicholas Johnson, Federal Communications Commission, on "The Financing of Educational Broadcasting." Introduced by John P. Witherspoon, general manager, KEBS-TV and FM, San Diego State College
item.dc:creator: American University (Washington, D.C.)
item.dc:subject: U.S. Politics

item.title: Sterling McMurrin, reel 2
item.description: Sterling M. McMurrin, chairman of the Commission on Instructional Technology and dean of the graduate school, University of Utah, comments on the work of the commission and then makes observations about problems involving technology and education.
item.dc:creator: American University (Washington, D.C.)
item.dc:subject: Public television--United States

item.title: McGeorge Bundy, reel 1
item.description: This program features "The Fifth Freedom," a keynote address and status report on public broadcasting by McGeorge Bundy, former national security advisor and current president of Ford Foundation.
item.dc:creator: American University (Washington, D.C.)
item.dc:subject: Public television--United States
